question_sentence: The Los Angeles Rams defeated the Cincinnati Bengals to win the Super Bowl this week. Who was the game’s MVP?
A swimmer in Australia died after a rare attack at a beach left them with "catastrophic injuries.” What creature attacked the swimmer?
Russian Olympian Kamila Valieva was cleared to compete this week, despite a positive drug test in December. What sport does she compete in?
For decades, a priest in Arizona was incorrectly performing which ceremony incorrectly by changing one word?
Washington Nationals star Juan Soto reportedly turned down a 13-year contract worth how much?
The U.S. suspended imports of which fruit after a plant safety inspector in Mexico received a threat?
Snowboarder Julia Marino says the International Olympic Committee required her to cover which company’s logo on her board?
A bright full moon graced the skies this week. Moons have different nicknames based on the seasons. What was February’s known as?
Which bank became the first to open in the metaverse this week?
This year’s Super Bowl halftime show featured Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Mary J. Blige, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar and a surprise guest. Who was it?
Why is Tesla billionaire Elon Musk being accused of animal cruelty?
choices: He was filmed running over a dog in his electric car
A company he owns has fitted monkeys with mind-reading chips
For keeping a caged pet tiger in his Silicon Valley office
He unveiled a new hi-tech mousetrap that electrocutes rodents
evidence: Musk-owned company Neuralink has also installed mind-reading chips in pigs during experiments aimed at developing ways of connecting human brains to machines

question_sentence: An inquiry has heard that how many Post Office workers were wrongly accused of theft, fraud and false accounting between 2000 and 2014?
evidence: The newly launched public inquiry was told that the prosecutions were based on incorrect accounting data from a Fujitsu computer system called Horizon, which was installed in Post Office branches in 1999

question_sentence: Which London art gallery was labelled ‘insensitive’ for selling an ear-shaped ‘earaser’ rubber in the gift shop at its Van Gogh: Self-Portraits exhibition?
evidence: The offending souvenir, which cost £6, has been removed from The Courtauld’s gift shop after the gallery was accused of making light of mental health issues

question_sentence: Which rapper made a surprise appearance at the NFL Super Bowl half-time show?
evidence: The In Da Club chart-topper joined fellow hip-hop ‘royalty’ including Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Mary J. Blige, Eminem and Kendrick Lamar

question_sentence: How many London stations will be on Crossrail’s delayed Elizabeth line?
evidence: Transport for London website has announced that the line, which is four years late and £4bn over budget, is on track to open ‘in the first half of 2022’

question_sentence: Which country has become the latest to change its name as part of a national rebrand?
evidence: The Eurasian state is ditching its almost century-old anglicised name and will be known instead as Turkiye

question_sentence: Popular online gaming platform Roblox is under fire after an investigation uncovered what in the virtual universe?
choices: Tutorials on how to use drugs
evidence: A probe by the BBC revealed that some users were creating virtual rooms where sex was simulated while other users watched. Almost two-thirds of all US children aged between nine and 12 use the platform

question_sentence: New research found that how many medium-size glasses of wine is enough to surpass the daily recommended sugar intake limit?
evidence: An analysis of more than 30 bottles of wine by the UK’s Alcohol Health Alliance (AHA) found that some contained as much as 59g of sugar – more than in a glazed doughnut

question_sentence: A so-called megadrought gripping the US West is the worst in the region in how long, according to a new study?
evidence: US reseachers said the ‘exceptional drought severity’ in the southwest of the country over the past 22 years was the worst since at least AD800

question_sentence: Streaming platforms in China have censored episodes of which hit US sitcom to remove an LGBTQ plotline?
evidence: All references to Ross Gellar’s ex-wife Carol being a lesbian have been removed from the hit show on at least four popular Chinese streaming platforms. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast
